results.title: Fundamentals of photography: the basic camera
results.brief_description: A simple explanation of how a camera functions showing the working of the various parts including the film holders, the lens and the shutters. A brief history of cameras is traced and the different types of camera are briefly described.
results.description: A simple explanation of how a camera functions showing the working of the various parts including the film holders, the lens and the shutters. A brief history of cameras is traced and the different types of camera are briefly described.

results.title: Fundamentals of photography: developing the negative
results.brief_description: This film shows the chemistry and procedure in developing still camera film, and explains the composition and function of the developing solution.

results.title: Fundamentals of massage
results.brief_description: Shows proper position of patient for massage; how to perform superficial and deep stroking and the importance of rhythm in stroking; how to knead; how to perform friction; and the value of each type of massage movement. The value of each type of massaging movement are also dealt with.

results.title: Fundamentals of diet
results.brief_description: Outlines types of animals with respect to their food habits and the classes of food in the human body are shown. There are a number of minimum requirements - in food-value and in vitamin content - which the human body must have if it is to be healthy. Experiments carried out on animals demonstrates the results of deprivation of any one or more of these necessities vital to health. The film ends with suggestions for substitutes for various classes of foods which whilst they are vital for health, are often very expensive or unobtainable.

results.title: Fundamental principles of immunization
results.brief_description: Explains the principles behind active and passive immunisations with vaccines and antisera. Shows production and testing of various immunising agents.

results.title: Functional anatomy of the hand (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Dissection of a human hand and arm shows the functional anatomy of the hand. Identifies the nerves and tendons responsible for the movement of hand and individual fingers and presents the procedures and precautions necessary for hand surgery.
results.description: Dissection of a human hand and arm shows the functional anatomy of the hand. Identifies the nerves and tendons responsible for the movement of hand and individual fingers and presents the procedures and precautions necessary for hand surgery.

results.title: Function of digestion (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A study of the digestive organs and the theory of digestion. Filmed experiments on rabbits discount the mechanical hypotheses of digestion and the effect of saliva on bread, changing starch to glucose, demonstrates the action of digestive enzymes. The wall of the intestine is also shown.

results.title: Full Circle (Oil)
results.creator_credit: Peter Sachs and W.M. Larkins Studio
results.brief_description: Shows the improved services and other benefits that oil brings to the backward territories. The financial and technical resources of foreign lands have tapped the liquid wealth hidden below the surface of the earth. In return a new prosperity and improved standard of living is being brought to the peoples of those formerly barren lands.

results.title: Full ahead Rhine
results.brief_description: Follows the journey of three of the thousands of barges which ply regularly up and down the Rhine and its tributaries. Describes some of the main towns, Dusseldorf, Cologne, Stuttgart Ludwighaven, and the industries of the areas surrounding the waterways, including coal mining, iron, steel, chemical, and primary industries.

results.title: Full ahead
results.creator_credit: Roger Mirams, Chris Stewart and Pacific Films
results.brief_description: Shows the fleet of the Australian National Line at work, shipping distant raw materials to centres of secondary industry. Forty-four ships call at fifty-three ports, some being specially fitted to carry a particular bulk cargo, such as semi-trailers on the ‘Bass Trader’. Cargo carried includes ironstone from Yampi Sound, softwoods from Stanley, and raw sugar from Townsville. Practical training of the crew is carried out on board under the captain’s supervision.
